Can we just isolate the virus from infected patients' blood? and then inject it into pretty much any mammal. Pigs, rabbits, mice and sheep are commonly used. Due to this response, within a few days, the mammals' blood will be teaming with antibodies against the antigens of the viral protein, which are then extracted and purified in a lab thus having a colony of living antibody factories.

Also, if you genuinely want to prevent the next pandemic arising from a virus scraped off from the floor of some remote cave with bats, dug up from beneath a bog or drilled out from under a glacier, you should never ever allow cultures of human cells, or for that, animals with human receptor gene spliced into them, to be anywhere near a lab that keeps or studies viruses in general.
Human cell cultures are cells that, despite having all the necessary characteristic of a human to a virus, had no immune system, making it the perfect target practice for any viruses that have been inoculated into them, for selecting for infectivity in humans. Even otherwise harmless virus may mutate to become harmful after being passed in human cells for a few hundred generations(less than a year, for the most parts).
Animals that have been engineered to express human receptors are a more challenging target, but once you had a strain that you “isolate” that could infect human cells, testing it in one of such animals make it the perfect opportunity for the virus to actually gain virulence and lethality, as animals do have an immune system that need to be overcame first.
Whenever a virus have been subjected to both culturing in human cells and testing in human receptor-expressing animals, it will become extremely likely that such a virus could then infect humans with ease. A virus that is novel, and of which there are no natural immunity to in the masses and a cure being likely non-existent. Each strain that were passed in human cells in a lab is a potential epidemic. BLAST tool:
https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Blast.cgi

The following are the BLAST search results of a part of the Wuhan Spike Glycoprotein sequence in comparison to the closest related natural coronavirus to date.

This is the result of an amino acid BLAST comparision between the two different glycoprotein sequences.

QHD43416.1, 681 to 1120.

Query: surface glycoprotein [Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2] Query ID: QHD43416.1 Length: 440



>spike glycoprotein [Bat coronavirus RaTG13]

Sequence ID: QHR63300.2 Length: 1269

Range 1: 681 to 1120



Score:901 bits(2329), Expect:0.0,

Method:Compositional matrix adjust.,

Identities:440/440(100%), Positives:440/440(100%), Gaps:0/440(0%)



Notice that there were ZERO amino acid difference between these two protein sequences. that is, these two sequences were identical.

A BLAST search on the corresponding nucleotides gives this result.

Query: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 isolate Wuhan-Hu-1, complete genome Query ID: MN908947.3 Length: 1560



>Bat coronavirus RaTG13, complete genome

>spike glycoprotein [Bat SARS coronavirus HKU3-8]

Range 1: 654 to 1093

This is an anti-science video. Your central claim - that we can't expose people to the virus to see if they get it after giving them the vaccine, therefore we must wait a year to see what happens to loads of them - is factually false and has nothing to do with science. Your whole argument falls with it.

Also collapsing with this is your claim for this to be about "believing in science", or that it proves that we should elect someone other than Trump who "believes in science" the way you do; science is not something to be "believed in" anyway, that's an oxymoron. What your argument is really about is that everyone should believe in your social prejudice that society should never ask such sacrifices of individuals for the greater good, and better for our society to perish than for it to do such a thing. It might be true if you said that it "will not" be done because not very good people, the kind who are filled with unsound prejudices like your own, are dominant in among journalists and bureaucracies and lawyers; but that's another matter.

In reality, no society has ever survived without asking for existential sacrifices by citizens in emergencies. And we could easily find people to take the risk for the greater good. In the worst case we could even coerce people to do it. But in reality we would get it done without any coercion; society would simply invite volunteers to take the risk of sacrificing themselves for their country and for humanity in this way, offering some incentives such as moral reward, honors that would be bestowed on them or on their memories, and compensation for their family. We would find many who would do it, starting with old people who would soon die anyway and would care to leave a safe world for their progeny, military people and veterans for whom courageous sacrifice for their country is what they pride themselves in, lifetime prisoners who could redeem their names and get some money for their family by taking the risk, others who are simply at the end of their wits, and above all, loads of people who would do it out of sound idealistic reasons - far more sound than your own idealisms.

Now, what ever happened to that claim of yours that it would take at least eight months, more likely a years or two, and that that's what "believing in science" means? And that everyone including Trump who cares about getting a vaccine soon enough to save potentially 100 million people around the world is an ignorant anti-science moron? Sure looks like the shoe is on the other foot and it's your prejudices that are anti-science, and monstrous from an ethical standpoint as well. I feel you really need to develop a sense of conscience about your apparent willingness to sacrifice millions of people to your social prejudices.

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
Orthomolecular Medicine News Service, Feb 2, 2020
Hospital-based Intravenous Vitamin C Treatment
for Coronavirus and Related Illnesses
by Andrew W. Saul and Atsuo Yanagisawa, MD, PhD

(OMNS February 2, 2020) No matter which hospital a coronavirus patient may seek help from, the question is, Will they be able to leave walking out the front door, or end up being wheeled out the basement backdoor? Prompt administration of intravenous vitamin C, in high doses, can make the difference.

Abundant clinical evidence confirms vitamin C's effectiveness when used in sufficient quantity. [1]

Physicians have demonstrated the powerful antiviral action of vitamin C for decades. [2]
Specific instructions for intravenous vitamin C

The Japanese College of Intravenous Therapy (JCIT) recommends intravenous vitamin C (IVC) 12.5/25g (12,500 - 25,000 mg) for acute viral infections (influenza, herpes zoster, common cold, rubella, mumps, etc.) and virus mimetic infections (idiopathic sudden hearing loss, Bell's palsy). In adults, IVC 12.5g is given for early stage illness with mild symptoms, and IVC 25g for moderate to severe symptoms. IVC is usually administered once or twice a day for 2-5 continuous days, along with or without general treatments for viral infections.

IVC 12.5g cocktail
Sterile water 125 mL
50% Vitamin C 25 mL (12. 5g)
0.5M Magnesium sulfate 10 mL
Add Vitamin B complex
Drip for 30-40 min

IVC 25g cocktail
Sterile water 250 mL
50% Vitamin C 50 mL (25g)
0.5M Magnesium sulfate 20 mL
Add Vitamin B complex
Drip for 40-60 min

Patients with acute viral infections show a depletion of vitamin C and increasing free radicals and cellular dysfunction. Such patients should be treated with vitamin C, oral or IV, for neutralizing free radicals throughout the body and inside cells, maintaining physiological functions, and enhancing natural healing. If patients progress to sepsis, vitamin C should be added intravenously as soon as possible along with conventional therapy for sepsis.

Toronto Star, 30 May 2003: "Fred Hui, MD believes that administering vitamin C intravenously is a treatment worth trying. And he'd like to see people admitted to hospital for the pneumonia-like virus treated with the vitamin intravenously while also receiving the usual drugs for SARS. 'I appeal to hospitals to try this for people who already have SARS,' says Hui. Members of the public would also do well to build up their levels of vitamin C, he says, adding that there is nothing to lose in trying it. 'This is one of the most harmless substances there is,' Hui states. 'There used to be concern about kidney stones, but that was theoretical. It was never borne out in an actual case.' Hui says he has found intravenous vitamin C effective in his medical practice with patients who have viral illnesses." [3]

Additional administration details are readily obtained from a free download of the complete Riordan Clinic Intravenous Vitamin C Protocol. [4] Although initially prepared for cancer patients, the protocol has found widespread application for many other diseases, particularly viral illnesses.

"Research and experience has shown that a therapeutic goal of reaching a peak-plasma concentration of ~20 mM (350- 400 mg/dL) is most efficacious. (No increased toxicity for posoxidant IVC plasma vitamin C levels up to 780 mg/dL has been observed.) . . . [T]he administering physician begins with a series of three consecutive IVC infusions at the 15, 25, and 50 gram dosages followed by post IVC plasma vitamin C levels in order to determine the oxidative burden for that patient so that subsequent IVCs can be optimally dosed."

Pages 16-18 of the Riordan protocol present IVC administration instructions.

I'd like to addres a few reasons to assume mRNA vaccines may be useless against SARS-COV-2:
➡️mRNA is a working copy of DNA which ones used for protein synthesis is immediately destroyed.One mRNA can only make one protein before it's destroyed.
➡️If the mRNA are specific to the viral surface proteins then an equal no. of viral proteins will form.
➡️This will definitely trigger n immune response and will give immunity.
➡️Since there are instances of re infections in ppl who had recovered from COVID-19 .it's safe to assume that this immunity won't last that long.
➡️Since re infections occur it may indicate the lack of long term secondary immune response due to the lack of memory T and B cells.
➡️Because the mRNA does not last in the cytoplasm and does not constantly make viral surface proteins and naturally acquired immunity is very short....is there really any use in investing and developing an mRNA vaccine against SARS-COV-2?
